website_summaries.verdict: If you need a serious trellis system for some major plants, this is a good choice even if you do have to supplement the hardware that comes with it.
pros: Built for heavy plants: grape vines and berry bushes
Tall components made of sturdy materials
Resists rust, insects, and the elements
cons: Expensive if you need more than one pack
Hardware isn't as strong as trellis parts

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. The predrilled holes for the crossbars are not made properly. Consequently the crossbars don’t align parallel to each other. Makes the whole trellis look cheap. The instructions say to use a hammer to pound the poles into the ground. DON’T DO THAT. The poles are made of fiberglass. Thus the hammer will pretty much destroy the tops of the poles. Also stand upwind when drilling or hammering the trellis. Otherwise get ready to breathe in bits of fiberglass fibers. Yuck.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lai

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Get your own hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Get your own hardware - my set didn't work. Seems like it's a pattern for other buyers as well. Was frustrating to have to go to the hardware store, but otherwise, I'm quite pleased with these!
customer_reviews.author: my2cents

customer_reviews.title: Nice clean solution for raspberry bush management
customer_reviews.text: So far this is holding up to our weather and is literally holding up our raspberry bushes! Nice clean appearance works great with 20 gauge wire between the stakes.
customer_reviews.author: JT Hargreaves

customer_reviews.title: the actual trellis seems good and i think should hold up well
customer_reviews.text: Hardware was very cheap, 2 of the nuts where not even threaded, broke two of the bolts... replaced all the hardware at Lowes for about $5. the actual trellis seems good and i think should hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom the Tech in Philly

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you check what you get
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two pack of raspberry trellis, but I only received one in the box! Update: Amazon fixed the problem. They refunded me and I ordered new set. Make sure when you order 2-pack or 4-pack that all trellises are there! I have not used the trellises yet since I am waiting to get the missing trellis, so I cannot comment on how it is going to hold up. It looks nice and hopefully will work well with my raspberry bushes.
customer_reviews.author: Gift Card

customer_reviews.title: Check packages for missing parts immediately.
customer_reviews.text: Product is adequate. Had problems with missing parts. This was corrected. Installed these on 2, 32 foot areas. Cross parts are a little too flexible once wire was strung but will work okay. Overall look is nice. I would have rated higher but with parts missing, holes poorly drilled and located I couldn’t go above a three.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Graves

customer_reviews.title: ... time using a trellis and this product made it easy. I did drill 1 extra hole to use ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st time using a trellis and this product made it easy. I did drill 1 extra hole to use small clamps to hold the wire.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Design and sturdy product for raspberries and other berries.
customer_reviews.text: I wished I had found this product when I planted my first raspberries... this is a great product. Don't hesitate to purchase this for your garden.
customer_reviews.author: INDYreads67

customer_reviews.title: The instructions didn't say how deeply to bury the trellis ...
customer_reviews.text: The instructions didn't say how deeply to bury the trellis. I had to set them both with rocks and they still bend toward the center.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Buening

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good material, but improperly drilled holes and not the proper number of nuts and bolts
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: It’s frustrating,, I just opened the package and I’m missing a part. The longer cross brace is missing. So I’m giving it 1 star
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Great Trellis Missing Hardware
customer_reviews.text: The trellis is great. However, one trellis was missing all the nuts and bolts and another was missing one bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Sweet Summer Love Clematis vine and it's working out great.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa  Osgood

customer_reviews.title: The plastic wrapper could not hold together during shipment.  Any dummy would have known that!
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived torn up, some is the hardware is missing and I am not sure I should use it or sent it back. If I choose to use it I’ll have to buy additional hardware and I am not happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: Celestina Curiel-Robb

customer_reviews.title: Great product, a few tweaks might be needed.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. A couple things to mention though. One set of holes to secure the crossbar were misaligned, but simple fix with a drill. The other thing is that they are made of fibreglass, and as such, you will get tiny splinters of it all over you, so wash your clothes right after and take a shower when you are done installing. Lastly, do not pound the post in directly with a sledge hammer like a previous reviewer did. Pit a board on top first and you won't destroy the post.
customer_reviews.author: AMB

product_meta.title: EcoTrellis, Raspberry Trellis and Stake, Vineyard Trellis, Pack of 2

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars20 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
